author: r.alxz
content: a while ago my colleague Everton Fraga added a search to blog.ethereum.org, i believe using algolia, and he shared with me that it would be very cool to have this same search functionality on the EIPs website, and since he said that, i haven't been able to stop thinking about it ðŸ˜„

author: r.alxz
content: then i just recently saw hardhat added it to their docs

author: r.alxz
content: what do others think about adding a similar search widget to eips.ethereum.org ?

author: georgetrotter
content:
Hey Eth R&D! Please let me know if this is not the right place for this post, very happy to move it. Given the people in the community that engage in this discord, I thought someone here might be interested in this opportunity. 

The EF's Ecosystem Support Program is looking to add a team member as a full time Guide! 

The Guides are the faces of ESP for those entering the ecosystem support pipeline and front-line representatives for the Ethereum Foundation, helping to facilitate the growth of the Ethereum ecosystem by connecting developers and projects in the ecosystem with the support they need. The primary responsibilities of this role are reviewing inquiries, participating in exploratory calls with inquirers, and facilitating a wide range of ESP support.

Check out the job description to learn more: https://www.notion.so/efdn/Guide-for-the-EF-s-Ecosystem-Support-Program-a0d1c55666ed429899ffde39ed996817

Looking forward to hearing from you!
